DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for colon and rectal neuroendocrine tumor based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor Pathologic M Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A well differentiated, low or intermediate grade tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A well differentiated, low or intermediate grade tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum.

Concepts.definition: A well differentiated, low, intermediate, or high grade neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a colorectal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with both hepatic and extrahepatic metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with both hepatic and extrahepatic metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis in at least one extrahepatic site (e.g., lung, ovary, nonregional lymph node, peritoneum, bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis in at least one extrahepatic site (e.g., lung, ovary, nonregional lymph node, peritoneum, bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis confined to liver. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis confined to liver. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a colorectal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a colorectal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
